Summary My current position entails regular spatial data creation, maintenance and analysis. Manipulating vector data, interpreting aerial imagery, digitization and updating attribute information. I also am responsible for troubleshooting internal tools and correcting sensitive data. 
 
I have a background in applying applying Geographic Information Systems to problems that range from analyzing policy's spatial impact on physical systems with satellite based imagery to historic mapping and promoting digital humanities. 
 
My past work and education experiences include working in enterprise GIS environments, learn new software and analysis tools, present research at professional meetings, and collaborate on multi-institutional projects.  
 
Specialties: Geographic Information Systems, Remote Sensing, Web Mapping, Management, Collaboration, Outreach, STEM Education. Summary Whether it's making latte art teddy bears as a barista at Microsoft, or becoming proficient with the GIS software and internal debugging tools as a data specialist at Google Maps, I shamelessly nerd out on things that require focus and analytical nitpicking. The pillars of my working style are technical mastery, adaptive creativity, and making things elegant. As a lead at Google Maps, I help manage a team of 20 data specialists by providing training and guidance with tool usage and debugging, as well as knowing and interpreting policy. I keep close contact with management, HR, and other leads to ensure that communication of goals and expectations flows smoothly. I also keep track of the documentation, personnel, and progress of a constantly changing queue of projects ranging from sweet and simple to bizarre and dynamic.  
 
The management and mentors I've had the pleasure of encountering at Google Maps have made it easy for me to do my best at work and to enjoy my job. Everyone deserves that opportunity, and I prioritize reaching out to my coworkers to make sure they're confident with the processes and tools, and that they feel safe and valued in their workplace.  
 
My interests include but are not limited to project documentation, workflow development, skincare, nanomaterials, ceramic engineering, hiking and backpacking, medium format film photography, and a budding obsession with fantasy football. If you would like to connect with me regarding any, all, or none of those things, please reach out! I am not currently looking for a job, but I would love to make new professional acquaintances and renew/maintain contact with people already in my network.
